body:
UPD - the problem seems to be with spaCy 2.1 (and blis, presumably).  It surprised me that it tried to install that old version, as I tought I had read in the documentation that it works with spaCy 3.1
Here is where it gets stuck
Collecting sklearn
  Using cached sklearn-0.0.tar.gz (1.1 kB)
  Preparing metadata (setup.py) ... done
Collecting keras>=2.4.0
  Using cached keras-2.8.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl (1.4 MB)

INFO: pip is looking at multiple versions of holmes-extractor to determine which version is compatible with other requirements. This could take a while.
Collecting holmes-extractor
  Using cached holmes-extractor-2.2.1.tar.gz (115 kB)
  Preparing metadata (setup.py) ... done
Collecting spacy==2.1.0
  Using cached spacy-2.1.0.tar.gz (27.7 MB)
  Installing build dependencies ... /

Please try again with the new version Holmes 4.0.0, make sure you start with a completely fresh virtual Python environment (see https://docs.python.org/3/library/venv.html) and follow the instructions in the Holmes introduction exactly. The fact that spaCy 2.1 is involved suggests libraries may have been installed other than as part of the Holmes installation.
